criteria: Understanding of 'A Bundle of Ten Ones'
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate an understanding of tens and ones.
Student struggles to identify tens and ones in a two-digit number.
Student can identify tens and ones but has difficulty explaining their meaning.
Student can identify tens and ones and explain their meaning with some prompting.
Student can clearly identify and explain the meaning of tens and ones in a two-digit number.
Student demonstrates a thorough understanding of tens and ones, and can apply this knowledge to solve problems.
Student does not understand the concept of ten ones forming a ten.
Student struggles to relate ten individual units to a single group of ten.
Student can relate ten ones to a ten with some prompting.
Student understands that ten ones make a ten but struggles to explain the concept.
Student can explain the concept of ten ones making a ten, and provide examples.
Student demonstrates a deep understanding of how ten ones form a ten and can apply this concept in various contexts.
